translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter about the Buddha

analyzed: khadira vani ya revata tthera apadāna
translated: The Elder Khadiravaniya Revata’s Birth Story
The Ganges River is called the Bhāgīrathī,
and it flows from the Himalayas.
I was a boatman in Kuti,
and I ferried people across to the other side.
The Leader Padumuttara,

analyzed: sambuddhaḥ dvipad uttamaḥ  vasī sata sahassehi
translated: the Buddha, the Best of Humans,
was staying on the bank of the Ganges with a hundred thousand people.
Having gathered many boats,
and having them well-prepared by carpenters,
I made a roof over the boats
and paid homage to the Best of Men.
And after the Buddha had arrived,
he boarded that boat.
The Teacher, standing in the middle of the water,
recited these verses:
‘Whoever ferries across the Buddha,
and also the stainless Saṅgha,
through that faith in his mind,
he will delight in the world of the gods.
I will be reborn in your family,
well-made and sitting in a boat;🔽a flower-roof will always be held
in the sky above me.
For fifty-eight eons,
a noble one named Tāraka,
having conquered the four directions,
will be a Wheel-turning Monarch.
For fifty-seven aeons,
a noble warrior named Campaka,
the sun will rise,
shining with great power.
For a hundred thousand aeons,
born in the family of Okkāka,
with the clan name of Gotama,
a teacher will appear in the world.
Having passed away from the world of the gods,
he will go to the human state,
with the name Revata,
he will be a kinsman of Brahma.
Having gone forth from the home life,
urged on by the root of virtue,
in the Dispensation of the Blessed One Gotama,
he will go forth.
Having gone forth later,
with applied thought and insight,
having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished without pollutants.’
My energy is the yoke-bearing beast,
the vehicle for attaining security from bondage;
I bear this last body,
in the Dispensation of the Perfectly Awakened One.
The deed done for a hundred thousand (coins)
has shown its fruit to me here;
I am well-freed like one who has crossed a flood,

original: kilese jhāpayī mama.🔽Tato maṁ vananirataṁ,🔽disvā lokantagū muni;
analyzed: kilese mama  tatas mama vana nirata  disvā lokantagū muni
translated: I have burnt up my pollutants.🔽Then the sage who had gone to the end of the world,🔽seeing me devoted to the forest,
made me chief of the forest-dwelling monks,
the Great Sage gave his approval.
The four discriminations,
and the eight liberations as well,
The six super-knowledges were realized,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā khadiravaniyo revato thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā khadiravaniyaḥ revataḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus the Elder Revata Khadiravaniya,🔽recited these verses.

analyzed: khadira vaniya revata therassa apadānam navama
translated: The Story of the Elder Revata Khadiravaniya is finished.
